intro: Argostemma aequifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaved argostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and a dark green color. Its small, white to pink flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the summer months. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and stream banks.
